intro: Melandrium nubigenum, commonly known as the clouded catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open areas such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branched. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine.
